item.title: Our priorities
item.description: Our Vision Building a healthy future through community pharmacy Our Aims North of Tyne Local Pharmaceutical Committee represents, supports, develops and promotes NHS Community Pharmacy in Northumberland, Newcastle and North Tyneside. Representing Supporting To demonstrate to commissioners the value of service provision through community pharmacy To secure a fair level of payment and conditions for all services To work in the best interest of all community pharmacy contractors across the North of Tyne region To strive to ensure that existing services are recommissioned or expanded To represent contractorsâ€™ interests with all commissioners and other stakeholders To support community pharmacy contractors in delivering high quality, consistent services of benefit to patients To respond to local and national consultations relevant to community pharmacy To support the effective implementation of new services To respond to market entry and relocation consultations To support all pharmacies in the delivery of core services and the compliance with regulatory standards and guidance Developing Promoting To negotiate services and ensure community pharmacy plays an integral and growing role in healthcare provision across the North of Tyne region To promote community pharmacy to patients, public and stakeholders To develop business opportunities for community pharmacy To build and maintain effective links with internal & external stakeholders including: other LPCs & LRCs, commissioners, third sector organisations, the public, and, community pharmacy contractors To develop a sustainable vision and future for community pharmacy To develop the skills of community pharmacists and pharmacy teams via training and sharing best practice to enable effective service delivery Our Forward View We envisage a future where, through working in partnership with sustainability and transformation partnerships, integrated care systems and other NHS partners, community pharmacy is aligned and integrated with the local health economy and delivering a wide range of services supporting patients and the NHS.
